data.title: PALACE THEATRE, Watford Full list of productions - Doollee.com
data.meta_description: PALACE THEATRE, Watford Full list of productions - Doollee.com
data.text: PALACE THEATRE, Watford Full list of productions 1909 Jan. 4 th “The Diver’s Luck” Jan. 11 th Variety Jan. 18 th “Raffles” presented by Reginald Dane & Powerful Company. Between Acts 3 and 4 scenes from the “Earthquake in Italy” were shown on the Cinematograph - this was also showing next door at the Clarendon Hall along with “Our Army and Our Navy” and the “Famous Animals Entertainment”. Jan. 25 th “The Gay Gordons” Mr. Seymour Hicks Company (for three nights) and for the rest of the week “Grand Variety Co.” including Lillo, Otto and Lotto “the World’s Greatest Comedy and Trick Cyclists”. Feb. 1 st “Mrs. Dot” for the first three days followed by “Miss Hook of Holland” Feb. 8 th “Grand Star Vaudeville Company”. Feb. 15 th “As Midnight Chimes” - Sensational Realistic Novel Drama. Feb. 22 nd Variety. March 1 st Variety. March 8 th “The Sailor’s Wedding” Produced by Hardie and Van Leer March 15 th “Two Little Vagabonds” The Most Successful Play of Modern Times. Presented by Hardie and Van Leer’s London Company - from the Royal Princes Theatre, London. March 22 nd “Dick Whittington” March 29 th “An Englishman’s Home” by Major du Maurier. April 5 th “The Cingalee”, by Lionel Monckton and James T. Tanner. Musical Comedy. Entire production from Daley’s Theatre, London.. April 12 th Variety “STAIG TROUPE” including George Robey. April 19 th “When Knights Were Bold”. April 26 th “Swiss Express” - a musical pantomimical comedy. May 3 rd Variety, including Harry Tate in “Motoring. May 10 th “A White Man” by Edwin Milton Royle. May 17 th “Sergeant Brue”, musical comedy from the Strand and Prince of Wales Theatres, London. May 24 th Variety. May 31 st A-LAD-IN. And Well Out Of It - a play by Mr. W. Bruce Smith - performed by children of Drury Lane Theatre. Children admitted at half price to all parts June 7 th “My Sweetheart”, “A Wonderful Woman” and “Fritz and Katrina” - musical comedies. June 14 th Variety. June 21 st Variety. June 28 th Variety including Fred Lindsay (Australian Stock Whip manipulator) and Company. July 5 th “The Dandy Fifth” - delightful comic opera. July 12 th “Ruined by Drink” by Hall Caine. July 19 th Variety July 26 th Variety. The Programme included “A Vision of Japan” . Aug. 2 nd “At the World’s Mercy” by Carr Loates - successful Musical Comedy Drama. Aug. 9 th Splendid Variety Company Aug. 16 th “The Silver King” melodrama by Henry Arthur Jones. Aug. 23 rd Variety. Aug.30 th “The Christians” by Hall Caine - first three nights, presented by Wentworth Croke in the Lyceum version, direct from Lyceum and Shaftesbury Theatres. Last three nights “Idols” by Roy Horniman, from the Garrick Theatre. Sept.6 th “The Way Women Love”. Great Domestic Drama by Mrs. Frank Bateman. Sept.13 th “The World, The Flesh and The Devil” by Lesser Columbus. Sept. 20 th “Through the Divorce Court”. Great Play of enormous heart interest. On Saturday 18 th Sept. there was a performance by Besses o’ the’ Barn Band prior to a world tour. Sponsored by Baring Bros. Sept. 27 th Variety, including Nellie Wallace. Oct. 2 nd Flying matinee - Mr. Gaston Myers London Company in “Mrs. Wiggs of the Cabbage Patch”. Oct 4 th Variety. Oct. 11 th “The Coal King” - the Great Mining Drama. Oct. 18 th “The Prodigal Son” by Hall Caine - direct from Drury Lane Theatre, presented by Wentworth Croke. 1
